New Records: Baltimore Orioles scored 13 runs, the highest in the game.
Corbin Burnes recorded his 13th win of the season.
Cole Irvin recorded his first save of the season.
Key Match Events: Chicago White Sox scored 3 runs in the top of the 1st inning.
Baltimore Orioles scored 6 runs in the bottom of the 6th inning, a key turning point.
Baltimore Orioles came back to score 6 more runs in the bottom of the 8th inning.
The game ended with a final score of 13-3 in favor of the Baltimore Orioles.
Pre-Game Insights: The starting lineups included Gunnar Henderson and Anthony Santander for the Orioles, and Corey Julks and Andrew Benintendi for the White Sox.
Post-Match Reflections: Baltimore Orioles' manager Brandon Hyde expressed pride in the team's performance and the come-from-behind win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Oriole Park at Camden Yards with an attendance of 35,906.
The game took 3 hours and 14 minutes to complete.
Others: The Orioles' Cedric Mullins hit a home run in the bottom of the 8th inning.
